attributes.name: SelectListbox
attributes.description:
Render a custom listbox element. Can be used in block-form or inline form. Yields an option object which can be used to customize each option in the listbox.

# inline

{{select-listbox
  onChange=(action (mut selectedName))
  selected=selectedName
  options=(array 'Steve' 'Bill' 'Katie')}}

# block

{{#select-listbox
  onChange=(action 'selectUser')
  selected=selectedUser
  options=users 
  as |option|
}}
  <div>
    <img src={{option.avatarUrl}} alt="" />
    <strong>{{option.name}}</strong> ({{option.userId}})
  </div>
{{/select-listbox}}

arguments.name: placeholder
arguments.description:
The placeholder option in your listbox. By default this will be empty. If a selection is already made, the placeholder will not be present.

{{select-listbox placeholder='Select a thing'}}

arguments.name: aria-label
arguments.description:
Adds an aria-label string to the select element

{{select-listbox aria-label='Select your preference'}}

arguments.name: aria-labelledby
arguments.description:
Adds an aria-labelledby string to the select element. This must referrence the id of another dom element that contains text that labels the select.

{{select-listbox aria-labelledby='id-of-the-labelling-element'}}

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description:
When true, adds the disabled boolean attribute to the input element

{{select-listbox disabled=true}}

arguments.name: required
arguments.description:
When true, adds the required and aria-required boolean attributes to the select element

{{select-listbox required=true}}

arguments.name: allowClear
arguments.description:
When true, adds a button element next to the select that calls onChange with an empty string

{{select-listbox allowClear=true}}

arguments.name: options
arguments.description:
This required array represents the options available to be selected. A few different formats are supported for this object:

{{select-listbox options=users}}
# array of strings
users: [
  'steve', 
  'bill', 
  'katie'
]
# array of objects with default keys
users: [
  { value: '1', label: 'steve', disabled: false },
  { value: '2', label: 'bill', disabled: false },
  { value: '3', label: 'katie', disabled: false }
]
# array of objects with custom keys
users: [
  { customValue: '1', customLabel: 'steve', customDisabled: false },
  { customValue: '2', customLabel: 'bill', customDisabled: false },
  { customValue: '3', customLabel: 'katie', customDisabled: false }
]

When using custom property keys, you must declare these keys using the valueKey (required), labelKey (optional), and disabledKey (optional) arguments.

arguments.name: selected
arguments.description:
This argument represents the currently selected option.

This argument should match the format of the items in your options array.

If options is an array of strings, then selected must be a string that matches one of the strings in the options array.

If options is an array of objects, then selected must be a object with a value property (or valueKey) that is equal to the value property (or valueKey) of one of the objects in the options array.

{{select-listbox selected='my option 1'}}

arguments.name: valueKey
arguments.description:
Declares a custom key for which the option value should be gotten from each object in the options array

{{select-listbox valueKey='customValue'}}

arguments.name: labelKey
arguments.description:
Declares a custom key for which the option label should be gotten from each object in the options array

{{select-listbox labelKey='customLabel'}}

arguments.name: disabledKey
arguments.description:
Declares a custom key for which the option disabled state should be gotten from each object in the options array

{{select-listbox disabledKey='customDisabled'}}

arguments.name: onFocus
arguments.description: a custom function that is run when the listbox receives focus

arguments.name: onBlur
arguments.description: a custom function that is run when the listbox loses focus

arguments.name: onChange
arguments.description:
This function is run whenever a selection is made by the user.

This function must change the value ofselected

attributes.name: SelectNative
attributes.description:
Render a native select element. Can be used in block-form or inline form. Yields an option object which can be used to customize each option in the select.

{{!-- inline form --}}

{{select-native
  onchange=(action 'changeMySelected')
  selected=mySelected
  options=myOption}}

{{!-- block form --}}

{{#select-native
  onchange=(action 'changeMySelected')
  selected=mySelected
  options=myOption as |option|
}}
  option.name (#{{option.id}})
{{/select-native}}

arguments.name: class
arguments.description: A string of css classes to be applied to the wrapping div. Defaults to select-native

arguments.name: focusedClass
arguments.description: A string of css classes to be conditionally applied to the wrapping div when the select element is focused. Defaults to select-native--focus

arguments.name: selectClass
arguments.description: A string of css classes to be applied to the select element. Defaults to select-native__select

arguments.name: optionClass
arguments.description: A string of css classes to be applied to each option element. Defaults to select-native__option Note: most browsers will ignore any styles applied to this class

arguments.name: placeholder
arguments.description:
The placeholder option in your select. By default this will produce an empty option. If a selection is already made, the placeholder will not be present.

{{select-native placeholder='Please make a selection'}}

arguments.name: aria-label
arguments.description:
Adds an aria-label string to the select element.

{{select-native aria-label='Select your preference'}}

arguments.name: aria-labelledby
arguments.description:
Adds an aria-labelledby string to the select element. This must referrence the id of another dom element that contains text that labels the select.

{{select-native aria-labelledby='id-of-the-labelling-element'}}

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description:
When true, adds the disabled boolean attribute to the select element

{{select-native disabled=true}}

arguments.name: required
arguments.description:
When true, adds the required and aria-required boolean attributes to the select element

{{select-native required=true}}

arguments.name: options
arguments.description:
This required array represents the options available to be selected. A few different formats are supported for this object:

{{select-native options=users}}
# array of strings
users: [
  'steve', 
  'bill', 
  'katie'
]
# array of objects with default keys
users: [
  { value: '1', label: 'steve', disabled: false },
  { value: '2', label: 'bill', disabled: false },
  { value: '3', label: 'katie', disabled: false }
]
# array of objects with custom keys
users: [
  { customValue: '1', customLabel: 'steve', customDisabled: false },
  { customValue: '2', customLabel: 'bill', customDisabled: false },
  { customValue: '3', customLabel: 'katie', customDisabled: false }
]

When using custom property keys, you must declare these keys using the valueKey (required), labelKey (optional), and disabledKey (optional) arguments.

arguments.name: selected
arguments.description:
This argument represents the currently selected option.

This argument should match the format of the items in your options array.

If options is an array of strings, then selected must be a string that matches one of the strings in the options array.

If options is an array of objects, then selected must be a object with a value property (or valueKey) that is equal to the value property (or valueKey) of one of the objects in the options array.

{{select-native selected='my option 1'}}

arguments.name: valueKey
arguments.description:
Declares a custom key for which the option value should be gotten from each object in the options array

{{select-native valueKey='customValue'}}

arguments.name: labelKey
arguments.description:
Declares a custom key for which the option label should be gotten from each object in the options array

{{select-native labelKey='customLabel'}}

arguments.name: disabledKey
arguments.description:
Declares a custom key for which the option disabled state should be gotten from each object in the options array

{{select-native disabledKey='customDisabled'}}

arguments.name: onfocus
arguments.description:
a custom function that is run when the select receives focus

{{select-native onfocus=(action 'customOnFocus'}}

arguments.name: onblur
arguments.description:
a custom function that is run when the select loses focus

{{select-native onblur=(action 'customOnBlur'}}

arguments.name: onchange
arguments.description:
a custom function that is run when the user makes a selection

{{select-native onchange=(action 'customOnChange'}}
